LOS ANGELES, CA (July 24, 2013) -- Kobalt Music Group has signed an exclusive, worldwide administration deal with singer/songwriter Gavin DeGraw, it was announced today by Richard Sanders, President of Kobalt Music Group, and Wayne DeGraw, President of DeGraw Entertainment Group.

Through the deal Kobalt will represent DeGraw’s new works, including his upcoming new album and new single, “Best I Ever Had” (RCA), which was co-written by DeGraw and producer Martin Johnson. Additionally Kobalt’s global synch staff will represent DeGraw’s music for use in film, TV, advertising, and other media.

Sweeter (RCA), DeGraw's last studio album, spawned the hit "Not Over You." The album features collaborations with a host of top-notch producers including Kobalt client and OneRepublic front man Ryan Tedder, Butch Walker, Eric Rosse, Tori Amos, and Ron Aniello. In the interim between albums, the singer appeared on season 14 of the U.S. hit TV series Dancing With The Stars.

DeGraw has enjoyed success since breaking through in 2003 with his debut album, Chariot (J Records), which sold over a million copies, earned platinum certification, and yielded three hit singles: “I Don’t Want To Be,” “Follow Through,” and the title-track, “Chariot.”  He has toured the globe, performing sold-out headlining shows as well as festivals with a variety of artists and is currently on a summer North American tour with Train and The Script through September.
